2.text: “How long until you end these speeches? Show some sense, and then we can talk.

3.text: Why are we regarded as cattle, as stupid in your sight?

4.text: You who tear yourself in anger—should the earth be forsaken on your account, or the rocks be moved from their place?

5.text: Indeed, the lamp of the wicked is extinguished; the flame of his fire does not glow.

6.text: The light in his tent grows dark, and the lamp beside him goes out.

7.text: His vigorous stride is shortened, and his own schemes trip him up.

8.text: For his own feet lead him into a net, and he wanders into its mesh.

9.text: A trap seizes his heel; a snare grips him.

10.text: A noose is hidden in the ground, and a trap lies in his path.

11.text: Terrors frighten him on every side and harass his every step.

12.text: His strength is depleted, and calamity is ready at his side.

13.text: It devours patches of his skin; the firstborn of death devours his limbs.

14.text: He is torn from the shelter of his tent and is marched off to the king of terrors.

15.text: Fire resides in his tent; burning sulfur rains down on his dwelling.

16.text: The roots beneath him dry up, and the branches above him wither away.

17.text: The memory of him perishes from the earth, and he has no name in the land.

18.text: He is driven from light into darkness and is chased from the inhabited world.

19.text: He has no offspring or posterity among his people, no survivor where he once lived.

20.text: Those in the west are appalled at his fate, while those in the east tremble in horror.

21.text: Surely such is the dwelling of the wicked and the place of one who does not know God.”
